				,
"Impact":"Different interpretation of the term 'park'; potential confusion among respondents regarding the use of park facilities",
"Mitigation":"Explicitly define the term 'park' in future research to ensure consistent interpretation; provide clear descriptions of different types of park facilities to minimize confusion",
"Technologies":"Use of detailed and visual aids (e.g., maps, images) to illustrate various types of park facilities; virtual tours of park facilities for accurate representation",
"People":"Respondents of self-reported surveys, general public, urban residents, older residents",
"Owner":"Researchers, survey designers, park administrators"
},
{"Description":"Recall bias in self-reported park use frequency before the pandemic",
"Impact":"Inaccurate reporting of park use frequency, leading to unreliable data and misleading conclusions",
"Mitigation":"Use retrospective pre-post designs with baseline measures when available; incorporate multiple data sources (e.g., cell phone data, GPS tracking) to validate self-reported park use",
"Technologies":"Cell phone data, GPS tracking, data validation techniques, statistical modeling",
"People":"Survey respondents, researchers, data analysts",
"Owner":"Research teams, data collection agencies, technology providers"
},
{"Description":"Underrepresentation of certain groups in cell phone data (e.g., older residents)",
"Impact":"Limited representation of specific demographic groups may skew the analysis and conclusions",
"Mitigation":"Use supplementary data sources to fill the gaps in demographic representation; employ statistical weighting to adjust for underrepresentation",
"Technologies":"Statistical weighting techniques, supplementary data sources, demographic profiling tools",
"People":"Demographic groups underrepresented in cell phone data, data analysts",
"Owner":"Data collection agencies, technology providers, researchers"
},
{"Description":"Inadvertent exclusion of certain types of public recreation resources through the filtering process",
"Impact":"Incomplete and biased assessment of park use due to the exclusion of relevant public recreation resources",
"Mitigation":"Refine the filtering process to include a broader range of public recreation resources; conduct sensitivity analysis to assess the impact of exclusion",
"Technologies":"Advanced filtering algorithms, sensitivity analysis tools, data validation techniques",
"People":"Users of public recreation resources, researchers",
"Owner":"Data collection agencies, technology providers, park administrators"
}]}
